Class javachart.chart.Globals 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class javachart.chart.Globals 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----javachart.chart.Globals
public class Globals
extends Object
Certain information needs to be available to almost all JavaChart classes. This includes things like whether a chart should have 3-D effects, how large is the drawing surface, etc. The Globals class is used to store all this information. For standard JavaChart graphs, this class is instantiated once, and then references are propagated to the classes that require them. Since Java passes this information by reference, a global change requires only a change to the Globals class stored in the top-level Chart class. A couple of fairly obscure, but necessary components in this class include stringRotator and image. Since graphics strings are rotated with raster operations, and because these operations require access to the drawing canvas used by all the other drawing classes, this information must be available globally.
See Also:
Gc, RotateString, DisplayList

Globals()
Does nothing.
Globals(int, int, int, boolean, RotateString, Image)
Initialize several internal variables with the given arguments.

getDisplayList()
Returns the current DisplayList
getImage()
Returns the internal image used by RotateString class.
getMaxY()
Returns the maximum Y value (in pixels) for this chart
getStringRotator()
Return this chart's RotateString class
getUseDisplayList()
Activates a global DisplayList for this entire chart
getXOffset()
Returns the X offset used by 3-D charts.
getYOffset()
Returns the Y offset used by 3-D charts.
isThreeD()
Inquires whether this chart should use 3-D effects
setDisplayList(DisplayList)
Installs a new display list.
setImage(Image)
Set the internal image used by RotateString class.
setMaxY(int)
Set the maximum Y value (in pixels).
setStringRotator(RotateString)
Installs a new RotateString class for use by the entire chart
setThreeD(boolean)
Sets the 3-D effects value for this chart
setUseDisplayList(boolean)
Enable or disable this chart's DisplayList
setXOffset(int)
Set the X offset used by 3-D charts.
setYOffset(int)
Set the Y offset used by 3-D charts.

Globals 
  public Globals()
Does nothing.
Globals 
  public Globals(int topY,
                 int xDepth,
                 int yDepth,
                 boolean showDepth,
                 RotateString r,
                 Image i)
Initialize several internal variables with the given arguments.
Parameters:
topY - Height of the chart
xDepth - X offset for doing 3-D chart
yDepth - Y offset for doing 3-D chart
showDepth - To show, or not to show 3-D chart
r - Internal variable used by RotateString class
i - Internal image used by RotateString class

isThreeD 
  public boolean isThreeD()
Inquires whether this chart should use 3-D effects
Returns:
True if charts will be drawn with 3-D effect
setThreeD 
  public void setThreeD(boolean depth)
Sets the 3-D effects value for this chart
Parameters:
depth - True if chart should show a 3-D effect

Returns:

setMaxY 
  public void setMaxY(int i)
Set the maximum Y value (in pixels). Usually this is set automatically by calls to resize methods.
Parameters:
i - New maximum Y value
getStringRotator 
  public RotateString getStringRotator()
Return this chart's RotateString class
Returns:
A RotateString class used by other chart classes

Installs a new RotateString class for use by the entire chart

Returns:

Parameters:
